channel.title: documentation on Bas-Man's Musings
channel.description: Recent content in documentation on Bas-Man's Musings

item.title: Swift: Deconstruct SPF
item.description:
Hi,

I have been working on this project on and off for a bit now. So I thought it was time to go over how we might be able to not only internally document our code, but also to document it at the package level.

item.title: Rust: Move from binary to library and Add Documentation Examples that are tested.
item.description: In the previous article in this series I went through some basics of documenting your rust code. I had hoped to be able to take advantage of another nice feature of rust. That being the fact that code examples are actually tested by rust. I will go through the changes I had to make for this to work.

item.title: Rust: Documenting your Code
item.description:
Hi.
As with all projects. It’s important to create documentation. This is, as we know, very important when creating code. When we come back to a project after a break, or if someone new takes over. Documentation will help you remember or learn what the code does. The thinking that was behind certain decisions.
